trans-unit.source: Relayed Messaging Tutorial
trans-unit.target: Relayed Messaging Tutorial

trans-unit.source: Service Bus Relayed Messaging Tutorial
trans-unit.target: Service Bus Relayed Messaging Tutorial

trans-unit.source: The following topics describe how to build a simple <token>sb1</token> client application and service using the <token>sb2</token> “relay” messaging capabilities.
trans-unit.target: The following topics describe how to build a simple <token>sb1</token> client application and service using the <token>sb2</token> “relay” messaging capabilities.

trans-unit.source: For a corresponding tutorial that describes how to build an application that uses the <token>sb2</token> “brokered,” or asynchronous messaging capabilities, see the <link xlink:href="74aae7f2-c646-4a62-bb43-d9fe72f65d5d" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Azure AppFabric Service Bus Messaging Features Tutorial</link>.
trans-unit.target: For a corresponding tutorial that describes how to build an application that uses the <token>sb2</token> “brokered,” or asynchronous messaging capabilities, see the <link xlink:href="74aae7f2-c646-4a62-bb43-d9fe72f65d5d" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Azure AppFabric Service Bus Messaging Features Tutorial</link>.

trans-unit.source: The topics that are contained in this section cover the <token>sb2</token> programming experience.
trans-unit.target: The topics that are contained in this section cover the <token>sb2</token> programming experience.

trans-unit.source: They are designed to be completed in the order listed at the bottom of this topic.
trans-unit.target: They are designed to be completed in the order listed at the bottom of this topic.

trans-unit.source: Working through this tutorial gives you an introductory understanding of the steps that are required to create a <token>sb2</token> client and service application.
trans-unit.target: Working through this tutorial gives you an introductory understanding of the steps that are required to create a <token>sb2</token> client and service application.

trans-unit.source: Like their <token>indigo2</token> counterparts, a service is a construct that exposes one or more endpoints, each of which exposes one or more service operations.
trans-unit.target: Like their <token>indigo2</token> counterparts, a service is a construct that exposes one or more endpoints, each of which exposes one or more service operations.

trans-unit.source: The endpoint of a service specifies an address where the service can be found, a binding that contains the information that a client must communicate with the service, and a contract that defines the functionality provided by the service to its clients.
trans-unit.target: The endpoint of a service specifies an address where the service can be found, a binding that contains the information that a client must communicate with the service, and a contract that defines the functionality provided by the service to its clients.

trans-unit.source: The main difference between a <token>indigo2</token> and a <token>sb2</token> service is that the endpoint is exposed in the cloud instead of locally on your computer.
trans-unit.target: The main difference between a <token>indigo2</token> and a <token>sb2</token> service is that the endpoint is exposed in the cloud instead of locally on your computer.

trans-unit.source: After you work through the sequence of topics in this tutorial, you will have a running service, and a client that can invoke the operations of the service.
trans-unit.target: After you work through the sequence of topics in this tutorial, you will have a running service, and a client that can invoke the operations of the service.

trans-unit.source: The first topic describes how to set up an account.
trans-unit.target: The first topic describes how to set up an account.

trans-unit.source: The next three topics describe how to define a service that uses a contract, how to implement the service, and how to configure the service in code.
trans-unit.target: The next three topics describe how to define a service that uses a contract, how to implement the service, and how to configure the service in code.

trans-unit.source: They also describe how to host and run the service.
trans-unit.target: They also describe how to host and run the service.

trans-unit.source: The service that is created is self-hosted and the client and service run on the same computer.
trans-unit.target: The service that is created is self-hosted and the client and service run on the same computer.

trans-unit.source: You can configure the service by using either code or a configuration file.
trans-unit.target: You can configure the service by using either code or a configuration file.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="c3c38827-e436-4e31-8ea6-3d90e6d169d4" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Configuring an AppFabric Service BusApplication</link> and <link xlink:href="5f8947bc-26c6-4b15-a3a4-74bd3a0edb58" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Building a Service for the AppFabric Service Bus</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="c3c38827-e436-4e31-8ea6-3d90e6d169d4" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Configuring an AppFabric Service BusApplication</link> and <link xlink:href="5f8947bc-26c6-4b15-a3a4-74bd3a0edb58" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Building a Service for the AppFabric Service Bus</link>.

trans-unit.source: The next three topics describe how to create a client application, configure the client application, and create and use a client that can access the functionality of the host.
trans-unit.target: The next three topics describe how to create a client application, configure the client application, and create and use a client that can access the functionality of the host.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="3468b3db-91b6-4e76-a5ff-216d4c765d05" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Building an AppFabric Service Bus Client Application</link> and <link xlink:href="10410312-3deb-4723-a869-f9301d5480c3" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Discovering and Exposing an AppFabric Service Bus Application</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="3468b3db-91b6-4e76-a5ff-216d4c765d05" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Building an AppFabric Service Bus Client Application</link> and <link xlink:href="10410312-3deb-4723-a869-f9301d5480c3" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Discovering and Exposing an AppFabric Service Bus Application</link>.

trans-unit.source: All of the topics in this section assume that you are using Visual Studio as the development environment.
trans-unit.target: All of the topics in this section assume that you are using Visual Studio as the development environment.

trans-unit.source: For more in-depth information about how to create <token>sb2</token> client applications and hosts, see the <link xlink:href="20163576-85ca-4532-a391-6030a4549973" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Developing Applications that Use the AppFabric Service Bus</link> section.
trans-unit.target: For more in-depth information about how to create <token>sb2</token> client applications and hosts, see the <link xlink:href="20163576-85ca-4532-a391-6030a4549973" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Developing Applications that Use the AppFabric Service Bus</link> section.
